page.title: 11GORGATE HALL FRUIT FARM
page.content: A fruit farm was established in the grounds of Gorgate Hall, Hoe in 1941.It covers 325 acres and the following fruit is grown: Blackcurrants 100 acres (300 tonnes per annum (p.a.) Apples 52 acres (500 tonnes p.a.) Victoria plums 8 acres (40 tonnes p.a.) Pears 6 acres (40 tonnes p.a.) Blackcurrants are sold to Beechams for use in the fruit drink, Ribena. The apples are sold through a marketing co-operative. The plums and pears are sold in the farm shop at Gorgate Hall. Nine people are permanently employed on the farm. Ten students are employed during the summer to bag the fruit. All blackcurrant picking is now mechanised.
